metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25709 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenLDAP. This flaw allows an attacker who can send a malicious packet to be processed by OpenLDAPâ€™s slapd server, to trigger an assertion failure. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.11
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.11
slapd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.11
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openldap package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.42+dfsg-2ubuntu3.11').
